comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: While J. H. Choate was U. S. Ambassador to Britain (1899-1905), Henry White served as the embassy secretary. But who was Austen?

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: It's Austen G. Fox (Austen George Fox, 1849-1937, according to www.worldcat.org/identities/lccn-n85-363486), a lawyer who was candidate for District Attorney in 1897 (query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F20B1FFA385416...) The New-York tribune., June 01, 1902, Page 4 (with photo) says that he was Vice-President of the Harvard Club in 1902. The sun., January 24, 1915, FIFTH SECTION, Page 9, last column ("NOVEL INSURANCE POLICY A MEMORIAL OF R. W. GILDER") mention him together with Joseph H. Choate.
